definition:
The *median* of a triangle is a line segment joining a vertex with the
midpoint of the opposite side.

In the next figure, $AA'$ is a median. That is, $BA'=A'C$, or
equivalently, $A'$ is the midpoint of $BC$.

![image](median)

If the length of the three sides of the triangle are known, the length
of the medians can be found by means of Apollonius theorem.
